doc.description: An overview of BrightstarDB and quick links to getting started.
An overview of the BrightstarDB architecture, data model and client APIs.
Just a few of the key reasons why BrightstarDB should be your storage option of choice.
A step-by-step guide to building your first BrightstarDB application.
How to create BrightstarDB client connection strings
BrightstarDB supports two different types of index persistence. This section explains their differences and how to choose the right one for your application.
Guide to developing with the BrightstarDB Entity Framework.
Samples showing how to build application using the BrightstarDB Entity Framework.
Guide to developing with the BrightstarDB Data Object Layer API.
Information and examples for the Dynamic API.
Guide to developing with the BrightstarDB RDF Client API.
How to use BrightstarDB in your Windows Phone apps.
How to configure and use the SPARQL service.
How to manage BrightstarDB stores from your code.
Explanation of the different caching options and how to enable them.
Explanation of the different logging options.
How to configure, backup and restore BrightstarDB databases.

doc.title: API Reference
doc.description: A class-by-class API reference for BrightstarDB.
Describes Polaris, the GUI management studio for managing BrightstarDB instances.
How to configure and run BrightstarDB as an embedded database or a database server.

doc.title: BrightstarDB Licensing Options
doc.description: A guide to the licensing options available for using BrightstarDB.
This section describes the support in BrightstarDB for the various RDF syntaxes both for import and export.
Installing, configuring and developing with the SdShare Server.
A list of the major changes and updates introduced in each version of BrightstarDB.
A list of known issues with BrightstarDB and their workarounds.
